gurmukhi: jwgVdMg jIqw KwgVdMg KyqM ] BwgVdMg Bwgy kwgVdMg kyqM ]
transliteration: Jaagaddan Jeetaa Khadganndan Khetan|| Bhaagaddan Bhaage Kaagaddan Ketan||
translation: In this way the war was conquered and in this war many warriors fled away;

gurmukhi: swgVdMg sUrwnu juMAwn pyKw ] pwgVdMg pRwnwn qy pRwn lyKw ]577]
transliteration: Saagaddan Sooraan(u) Jounaan Pekhaa|| Paagaddan Praanaan Te Praan Lekhaa||577||
translation: Wherever the brave fighters saw one another, they cleared the account only on sacrificing their lives.577.

gurmukhi: cwgVdMg icMqM pwgVdMg pRwjI ] swgVdMg sYnw lwgVdMg lwjI ]
transliteration: Chaagaddan Chntan Paagaddan Praajee|| Saagaddan Sainaa Laagaddan Laajee||
translation: The army felt ashamed on remembering the defeat;

gurmukhi: swgVdMg sugRIv qy Awid lYkY ] kwgVdMg kopy qwgVdMg qYkY ]578]
transliteration: Saagaddan Sougreev Te Aadh Laikai|| Kaagaddan Kope Taagaddan Laikai||578||
translation: Sugriva and others got highly enraged.578.

gurmukhi: hwgVdMg hnU kwgVdMg kopw ] bwgVdMg bIrw nmo pwv ropw ]
transliteration: Haagaddan Hanoo Kaagaddan Kopaa|| Baagaddan Beeraa Namo Paav Ropaa||
translation: Hanuman was also greatly infuriated and he stood firmly in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: swgVdMg sUrM hwgVdMg hwry ] qwgVdMg qYkY hnU qau pukwry ]579]
transliteration: Saagaddan Sooran Haagaddan Hdare|| Taagaddan Taikai Hanoo Tau Poukdare||579||
translation: All those who fought with him suffered defeat and for this reason Hanuman is called the “killer of all”.579.

gurmukhi: swgVdMg sunho rwgVdMg rwmM ] dwgVdMg dIjy pwgVdMg pwnM ]
transliteration: Saagaddan Sounho Raagaddan Raamannd|| Daagaddan Deeje Paagaddan Paanan||
translation: Hanuman said to Ram, “Kindly stretch your hand towards me and bless me,

gurmukhi: pwgVdMg pITM TwgVdMg Toko ] hro Awj pwnM surM moh loko ]580]
transliteration: Paagaddan Peethan Thaagaddan Thoko|| Daro Aaj Paanan Suran Moh Loko||580||
translation: “By patting me on my back and I shall conquer all the abodes of gods today.”580.

gurmukhi: AwgVdMg AYsy khXo Aau aufwno ] gwgVdMg gYnM imlXo m`D mwno ]
transliteration: Aagaddan Aise Kahyo Au Udaano|| Gadgaddan Gadnan Milyo Maddh Maano||
translation: Uttering these words Hanuman flew and it seemed that he had become one with the sky.

gurmukhi: rwgVdMg rwmM AwgVdMg AwsM ] bwgVdMg bYTy nwgVdMg inrwsM ]581]
transliteration: Raagaddan Ramannd Aagaddan Aasan|| Baagaddan Baithe Naagaddan Niraasan||581||
translation: Ram sat down disappointed, keeping the hope in his mind.581.

gurmukhi: AwgVdMg Awgy kwgVdMg koaU ] mwgVdMg mwry swgVdMg soaU ]
transliteration: Aagaddan Aage Kaagaddan Kooo|| Maagaddan Mdare Saagaddan Sooo||
translation: Whosoever came in front of Hanuman, he killed him,

gurmukhi: nwgVdMg nwkI qwgVdMg qwlM ] mwgVdMg mwry bwgVdMg ibswlM ]582]
transliteration: Naagaddan Naakitaagaddan Taalan|| Maagaddan Mdare Baagaddan Bidaalan||582||
translation: And thus killing (the forces) he reached on the bank of a tank.582.

gurmukhi: AwgVdMg eykM dwgVdMg dwno ] cwgVdMg cIrw dwgVdMg durwno ]
transliteration: Aagaddan Ekan Daagaddan Daano|| Chaagaddan Cheeraa Daagaddan Duraano||
translation: There a terrible-looking demon was hiding;

gurmukhi: dwgVdMg doKI bwgVdMg bUtI ] AwgVdMg hY eyk qy eyk jUtI ]583]
transliteration: Daagaddan Dekhibaagaddan Bootee|| Aagaddan Hai Ek Te Ek Jeetee||583||
translation: And at the same place Hanuman saw many herbs clustered with one another.583.
